channel.title: BBC News - England
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Mother wins court case over Staffordshire landfill site emissions
item.description: Rebecca Currie says her son's breathing difficulties have been made worse by landfill emissions.

item.title: Cyprus gang rape case: Woman appeals against conviction for lying
item.description: Her legal team says she retracted the rape allegation while under extreme pressure from police.

item.title: Ealing child death: Mother charged with murder of daughter
item.description: Five-year-old Aijah Thomas was found with fatal injuries at a house in Ealing, west London.

item.title: Charlie Elphicke: Ex-Dover MP released after serving half of sentence for sex assaults
item.description: Ex-Dover MP Charlie Elphicke was jailed for sexually assaulting two women nine years apart.

item.title: Geronimo owner accuses government of 'wall of silence'
item.description: Helen Macdonald says she has not been given any details relating to Geronimo's final hours.

item.title: Maddie Durdant-Hollamby: Man who killed girlfriend took his own life
item.description: Benjamin Green stabbed Maddie Durdant-Hollamby in the chest before killing himself, an inquest hears.

item.title: Rhamero West: Teenager arrested over fatal street stabbing
item.description: A 16-year-old boy is arrested on suspicion of murdering Rhamero West in Old Traffford.

item.title: M25 protests: Met arrests three over 'orchestration'
item.description: The three arrests bring the total number detained over the protests to 165.

item.title: Cows hurt as lorry carrying them overturns in Upper Broughton
item.description: Several cows are injured after the lorry transporting 39 of them crashed.

item.title: Covent Garden and St John's Wood to continue al fresco dining
item.description: Outdoor dining is made permanent in parts of central London but Soho's future remains unclear.

item.title: Afghan refugee: Taliban takeover 'like a scary movie'
item.description: Refugee Marwa Koofi fled Afghanistan after being abducted at Kabul airport as the government fell.

item.title: Would you use a hotel for house plants?
item.description: A "hotel" catering exclusively for house plants has opened in London, as sales soared during the pandemic.

item.title: Brendon Prince: Round-Britain paddleboarder completes challenge
item.description: Sea safety campaigner Brendon Price was escorted to shore by a flotilla of paddleboards.

item.title: Drunk driver with child in car smashes into lorry in Chesterfield
item.description: Declan Webster was racing with friends before the huge crash in Chesterfield.

item.title: The Birmingham LGBT café providing a safe space
item.description: The not-for-profit café has a "pay-as-you-feel" policy so people struggling financially can eat.

item.title: Dad of girl murdered by Stephen Leonard says review rebuff 'unfair'
item.description: Jim Holt's daughter Lorraine was murdered in 1979 by a man who would try to kill again in 2018.

item.title: St Neots woman with incurable cancer plans to row across the Atlantic
item.description: Kat Cordiner will be joined by two other women in an attempt to row the 3,000 mile crossing.

item.title: England move up to third in men's world rankings
item.description: Gareth Southgate's men climb to third in the Fifa world rankings, equalling their highest ever position.

item.title: Chris Hughton: Nottingham Forest sack boss after six defeats in seven matches
item.description: Nottingham Forest sack boss Chris Hughton after six defeats from seven Championship matches this season.

item.title: 'No decision on Derby points deduction' - EFL
item.description: The English Football League says no decision has been made on any potential points deduction for Derby County.

item.title: 'There will be some emotional bits' - Powell prepares for last Castleford home game
item.description: Team news as Castleford Tigers host Warrington Wolves in Thursday's Super League fixture at Mend-A-Hose Jungle (19:45 BST).
